title: Portfolio
section: Data Science Project about AI impact on Mental Health
text:
Data Science Project about AI impact on Mental Health
I was deeply involved in a Data Science project investigating the impact of AI chatbots and Social Media on mental health. I worked on the Problem Identification, Data Collection, Preparation, Analysis, and Communicating Results. Additionally, I contributed to documentation and repository management. I implemented simulation with ChatGPT to generate needed data, studied and analyzed it’s results.

Overview
GitHub Repository

title: Portfolio
text:
Machine Learning Projects
I developed a student dropout prediction model and a card classification model, using convolutional neural networks (CNN) TensorFlow.

Student Dropout Prediction (GitHub)
Cards Classification (GitHub)

title: Portfolio
text:
SDLC Educational Project development
I played a key role in a the group development of the initial stage of the Huddlearn project. It is an educational platform focused on supporting self-education and forming learning and project groups for students with similar mindsets. I served as the team lead, overseeing task distribution, organizing workflow and communication channels. I contributed to the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) documentation and UML diagrams, developed the platform structure and prototype, created the presentation video.

Project documentation
Video presentation

title: About
text:
I am a creative, sharp-minded and self motivated professional. My background includes master’s degrees in Computer Systems Engineering and Cinema and Television Art. I had work experience in art, cinema and television before the war touched my country. Participating in volunteer work and providing assistance during the initial months of the war was a transformative event. Reconsidering my life, I fully realized my desire to return to Computer Science, to give my creative achievements a new life and to explore the newborn miracle of Artificial Intelligence.
From that moment I spent more then several years of study in the fields of Software Development, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and much more. One of the real breakthroughs was my acceptance to the MIT Emerging Talent program. I am truly grateful to the Emerging Talent Team for my advancement, and for taking me further - to the MIT MicroMasters Program in Statistics and Data Science, I have started this year.
My blend of Computer Systems Engineering and Cinema and Television Art master’s degrees, combined with my diverse experience and recent years of study have turned me into an ideal candidate for the roles in today’s rapidly evolving world - where AI and creativity walks hand in hand in the codespace of the future.
I am ready to leverage emergent technological innovations, ready to create, ready to transform a creative vision into action.
